column2: ENGLISH
Expected Successor
This character is currently expected to succeed their superior upon their death or retirement.
Appointed me
Promised an Appointed Title
Refused an Appointed Title
Retracted a Promised Appointed Title
Stole My Future Appointed Title
Tried to Steal My Future Appointed Title
Nominated Me For Appointed Title
Promised a Relative an Appointed Title
Refused a Relative an Appointed Title
Retracted a Relative's Promised Appointed Title
Open Appointment Menu
Access decisions allowing you to nominate either yourself or your relatives as the Expected Successors to various Appointed titles.
Close Appointment Menu
Hide appointment nomination decisions to clear up some space on the decision list.
Stand Down as [From.GetTitle]
You consider yourself not fit enough to lead anymore. You have decided to stand down.
Nominate for [Root.Liege.GetTitle]

[Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName] currently controls an appointed office. You could approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName] and suggest that [Root.Liege.Liege.GetSheHe] appoint you as [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] successor.
Nominate for [Root.Liege.GetTitle]

[Root.GetFullName]'s superior, [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName], currently controls an appointed office. You could approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName] and suggest that [Root.Liege.Liege.GetSheHe] appoint [Root.GetFirstName] as [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s successor.
Nominate for [Root.Liege.GetTitle]

[Root.GetFullName]'s superior, [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName], currently controls an appointed office. You could approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName] and suggest that [Root.Liege.Liege.GetSheHe] appoint [Root.GetFirstName] as [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s successor.
Unnominate for [Root.Liege.GetTitle]

[Root.GetFullName] is actually the expected successor of his/her superior, [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]. You could approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName] and suggest that [Root.Liege.Liege.GetSheHe] not be appointed [Root.GetFirstName] as [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s successor anymore.
[This.GetFullName] is not already [This.Liege.GetFullName]'s Expected Successor.\n
You have appointed [From.GetFullName] to [FromFrom.GetFullName]'s former offices.
[From.GetTitle] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] has appointed [FromFrom.GetFullName] to several of your former offices.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [FromFrom.GetTitle] [FromFrom.GetFullName]
RE: Appointment to Office
[From.GetFullName]'s departure has left critical vacancies. As previously agreed, I am appointing you to fulfill those vacancies.
You will prepare to approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName].
You are considering nominating yourself as [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetFullName]'s expected successor.
Nominate yourself
Ask [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.TopLiege.GetFullName] to nominate you in return for a favor
I'll need to talk to [Root.Liege.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName].
I'll need to talk to the Regent.
I'll need to talk to the Prime Minister.
will consider your nomination.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName]
RE: Future Office Appointments
It has come to my attention that you are in need of a successor in the event of [From.Liege.GetTitle] [From.Liege.GetFullName]'s eventual death or retirement. I wish to apply for a position as the next holder of [From.Liege.GetHerHis] appointed offices.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName]
RE: Future Office Appointments
After considering your proposal, I have found your case most convincing. You may now consider yourself [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s expected successor.
Mission accomplished.
[From.GetTitle] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] is now expected to appoint [FromFrom.GetTitle] [FromFrom.GetFullName] as your successor.
[From.GetTitle] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] is now apparently expected to appoint [FromFrom.GetTitle] [FromFrom.GetFullName] as [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s successor.
Damn you, [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName], we had a deal!
Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFullName], is apparently no longer [From.Liege.GetTitle] [From.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s expected successor.
You gave me your word, damn you!

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName]
RE: Future Office Appointments
After considering your proposal, I regret to inform you that I cannot accept your nomination at this time.
Well, it was worth a try.
[FromFrom.GetTitle] [FromFrom.GetFullName] nominated [FromFrom.GetHerselfHimself] as your successor, but did not receive [From.GetTitle] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s approval.

[FromFrom.GetTitle] [FromFrom.GetFullName] tried to nominate [FromFrom.GetHerselfHimself] as [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s successor, but did not receive [From.GetTitle] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s approval.
You have decided to nominate one of your relatives as the successor to their current superior, and identified the individual currently responsible for handling such appointments.
Well, would you look at that, it's me!
I'll need to talk to their superior's superiors.
I'll need to talk to the Regent.
I'll need to talk to the Prime Minister.

TO: [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName]
RE: Future Office Appointments
Given your exemplary track record of service to both our family and the nation, I have decided to appoint you as [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s successor upon [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] death or retirement.
Why, thank you, [GetFromRelation].
[From.GetTitle] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] is now expected to appoint [FromFrom.GetFullName] as your successor.
[From.GetTitle] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] is now expected to appoint [FromFrom.GetFullName] as [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetFullName]'s successor, rather than you.
You gave me your word, damn you!
[From.GetTitle] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] now intends to appoint [FromFrom.GetFullName] as [FromFrom.Liege.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Liege.GetFullName]'s successor, rather than your chosen candidate.
You gave me your word, damn you!

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName], intends to suggest that you be appointed [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s successor in the event of [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] death or retirement.
Why, thank you, [GetFromRelation].

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [FromFrom.GetTitle] [FromFrom.GetFullName]
RE: Future Office Appointments
It has come to my attention that you are in need of a successor in the event of [From.Liege.GetTitle] [From.Liege.GetFullName]'s eventual death or retirement. I wish to nominate [From.GetFullName] as the future successor to [From.Liege.GetHerHis] appointed offices.
[From.GetFullName] has approved the nomination. You are to be [Root.Liege.GetFullName]'s expected successor.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName]
RE: Future Office Appointments
After considering your proposal, I have found your case most convincing. You may now consider [FromFrom.GetFullName] to be [FromFrom.Liege.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Liege.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s expected successor.
It appears that [From.GetFullName] was unwilling to listen to reason. [From.GetSheHeCap] has rejected the nomination.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName]
RE: Future Office Appointments
After considering your proposal, I regret to inform you that I cannot accept your nomination at this time.
[From.GetFullName] rejected a request to make [FromFrom.GetFullName] your expected successor.
[From.GetFullName] rejected a request to replace you with [FromFrom.GetFullName] as expected successor.
Demand Resignation

As [From.GetTitle], you have the authority to demand [Root.GetFullName]'s resignation from [Root.GetHerHis] appointed offices. This authority cannot be used entirely freely - there is an associated cost in political capital - but as it is within your lawful authority, it will not anger of your other subordinates.
will either forfeit [This.GetHerHis] appointed titles or rebel.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetFullName]
RE: Resignation
Your most recent string of failures are the end of the line. Effective immediately, you are removed from command.
All of your appointed titles will be granted to your Expected Successor.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName]
RE: Resignation
I hereby acknowledge your orders and surrender command of all appointed titles.
